NoSchemaMessage.Row3: The "Edit" button won't show up in production mode.
NoSchemaMessage.Row2: You can also click the "Edit" button below to create a new schema or edit the existing schema.
NoSchemaMessage.Row1: Get started by setting the "schema" and "data" attributes to Schema Driven Form component.

ResourceStringPicker.WrongFormatActualText: Wrong format for actual text in the schema.

ViewModel.Message: * The following textbox is just for you to easily select all and copy. Nothing happens if you edit anything here.

SchemaText.Message1: You can directly edit the schema code here. After finishing editing, apply the schema to preview the form.
SchemaText.Message2: After finishing the editing, please don't forget to copy those schema code and paste to your source code or any place which can save it.
SchemaText.LintMessage: BTW, you may need this code......

PropertyForm.Footer: BTW, even this form is rendered by schema driven form. The schema of this form is dynamically generated.
PropertyForm.NoOptionSchema: This type and format doesn't have a defined "options" schema to render the fields, so please directly edit the "options" JSON here.

Welcome.Row7: If you set the property to be "Array" type, you need to define the array item schema.
Welcome.Row6: If you set the property to be "Object" type, you can add more child properties for it.
Welcome.Row5: You can also manage the order of those properties or remove any properties.
Welcome.Row4: Click the form property tree node then you can edit the detail of the form property.
Welcome.Row3: Each property maps to a form field in the UI.
Welcome.Row2: Or choose any child property schema node to edit the property schema of that node.
Welcome.Row1: Click the "+" button besides the "Schema" node to add properties.

Type.Description: It indicates the primitive data types which may be used on JSON data. E.g. for a string in the form data, no matter it uses textbox or dropdown, when it comes to the form data, it's still a string.

Format.Description: Different form field based on same data type may need to use different UI (format) to interact with the user. E.g. sometimes we want to use textbox to enter a string or use combobox to let the user to choose a string in given options.

Name.Description: This is the property name used in the form JSON data.

Label.Description: This is the text shows up as the label of the form field.

Welcome.Row5: You can get started by selecting the "Schema" node in the tree above and clicking the "+" button to add some property schemas there.
Welcome.Row4: Array property can only have one child property to define the array item schema.
Welcome.Row3: Object property can have multiple child properties to define the schemas of the object properties.
Welcome.Row2: Simple properties like String and Number cannot have child properties.
Welcome.Row1: Schema tree is the place for you to build the schema. Each tree node except the root "Schema" node stands for a property schema.

Welcome.Title: Welcome to Schema Driven Form Editor
Welcome.Row1: Schema Driven Form uses forms schema to render the form UI and handle the two way binding between UI and form view model.
Welcome.Row2: This tool can help you build the form UI with the form schema.
Welcome.Row3: You can edit the form schema with the schema tree (the "Visual" view) or with the schema code editor (the "Code" view).
Welcome.Row4: You can go to the Data tab to see how the form JSON data is generated or directly edit the form JSON data then see how the form UI renders it.
Welcome.Row5: You can go to the Form View Model Contract tab to generate the form view model contract and use it in your source code to do strong type check for your form view model.
Welcome.Row6: You can get started by selecting the "Schema" node in the tree in middle of the editor UI and clicking the "+" button to add some property schemas there.
Welcome.Row7: You can click "Apply schema and preview it" button any time to see how the form renders based on the schema you build.
Welcome.Row8: After finishing editing the schema, please switch to the "Code" view to copy the generated schema code.
Welcome.Row9: In order to render the form with the schema you just created or updated, please check in the schema code into your source code or put it to any place which won't get lost. Then bind the schema to Schema Form component.
Welcome.Row10: One ultimate trick of Schema Driven Form: you can construct the schema object dynamically with your code.

PreviewForm.Title: Preview
PreviewForm.EmptySchemaMessage: There is no properties added in the schema. Please select the "Schema" tree node and click "+" button to add some properties.

Editor.SwitchToCodeViewMessage: Don't forget to switch to "Code" view to get the edited schema code.
Editor.Title: Schema Driven Form Editor

access.addGroupsDescription: Add groups to control who can access the gateway.

access.onPrem: On-premises Active Directory and local groups
access.connectStep1: Download and extract the New-AadApp.ps1 script from​ this .zip file.
access.connectStep2: Open a PowerShell session and then run New-AadApp.ps1 -GatewayEndpoint <gateway-name>.
access.connectStep3: Refresh this page and enable the azure active directory option.
access.manageDesc: By default, all members of the Azure AD tenant can access the gateway, while only local administrators on the gateway system can administer the gateway.
access.manageSubTitle: To limit access to specific groups:
access.manageStep1: Go to your SME Azure AD app in the Azure portal.
access.manageStep2: On the Properties tab, set User assignment required to Yes.
access.manageStep3: On the Users and groups tab, select Add user, and then assign a role to each user or group you add.
access.saveWarning: After changing the identity provider, everyone using the gateway will have to refresh their browsers and sign in again.
access.manageNote: By default, all members of the Azure AD tenant can access the gateway, while only local administrators on the gateway system can administer the gateway.
access.aadInProgressMessage: Updating the identity provider to Azure Active Directory.
access.adInProgressMessage: Updating the identity provider to on-premises Active Directory and local groups.
access.aadSuccessMessage: Successfully changed the identity provider to Azure Active Directory - refresh this page to continue.
access.adSuccessMessage: Successfully changed the identity provider to on-premises Active Directory and local groups - refresh this page to continue.

Page2.Title: Help us build the future of computer management
Page2.Subtext: We are building on and improving Windows Admin Center, but we need your help to make sure it’s the best it can be. Click the link under the help section to send us feedback or suggestions. We look forward to hearing from you!

Page1.Title: Welcome to Windows Admin Center
Page1.Subtext: Windows Admin Center is a new web-based management solution from Microsoft, built to modernize and simplify administration of your Windows datacenter.

UpgradeExperienceDialog.SubtextNoPreviousVersion: Windows Admin Center has been updated to version {0}
UpgradeExperienceDialog.Subtext: Windows Admin Center has been updated from {0} to {1}
UpgradeExperienceDialog.Title: Windows Admin Center has been updated!

ConfirmationDialog.Message: Do you want to continue editing or discard your changes?
ConfirmationDialog.Title: You have unsaved changes

SeeAdditionalLicenseTerms.text: See additional license terms at: https://aka.ms/wac-eula

SessionExpiredDialog.title: Go back to the tool you were using?
SessionExpiredDialog.message: We closed it to conserve resources. To change the time we wait before closing a tool, go to {Link}.

CountDownDialog.title: You still here?
CountDownDialog.message: If not, we’ll close this tool to conserve resources. To change the time we wait, go to {Link}.

Password.Description: This SodaBuilder is password protected, You cannot make soda without the password. Hint: The password is "password"
Password.Title: Password

EmergencyProduction.Title: Emergency production
EmergencyProduction.Description: Turn this on if you need soda now! This will continuously dispense a stream of soda rather than filling each bottle then stopping.

ExtraSugar.Title: Extra sugar
ExtraSugar.Description: Adding extra sugar to the soda will make it sweet and mask the chemical flavors, but will be even worse for your health.

Tags.Title: Tags
Tags.Description: These tags will help others find your recipe in the intergalactic soda index.
